alert.note: Alert for Far South Miami-Dade County; Inland Broward County; Inland Collier County; Inland Miami-Dade County; Mainland Monroe (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 19 at 6:16PM EDT by NWS Miami
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Collier, northern Mainland Monroe, northern Miami-Dade and southern Broward Counties through 700 PM EDT... At 616 PM EDT, National Weather Service meteorologists were tracking a strong thunderstorm capable of producing a funnel cloud over Loop Road Ee Center, or 25 miles east of Chokoloskee, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Funnel clouds and winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Funnel clouds occasionally touch down and produce tornadoes or waterspouts. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... The Redland, Loop Road Ee Center, Everglades National Park, Big Cypress National Preserve, Fortymile Bend, Dade- Collier Training Airport, Shark Valley Obs Tower and Pa-Hay- Okee Overlook. FUNNEL CLOUD...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: These winds can down small tree limbs and branches, and blow around unsecured small objects. Seek shelter in a safe building until the storm passes. Funnel clouds occasionally touch down and produce tornadoes or waterspouts. Move indoors and stay away from windows.

area.areaDesc: Far South Miami-Dade County; Inland Broward County; Inland Collier County; Inland Miami-Dade County; Mainland Monroe
